0.user_question: John drives for 3 hours at a speed of 60 mph and then turns around because he realizes he forgot something very important at home.  He tries to get home in 4 hours but spends the first 2 hours in standstill traffic.  He spends the next half-hour driving at a speed of 30mph, before being able to drive the remaining time of the 4 hours going at 80 mph.  How far is he from home at the end of those 4 hours?

ost_step.1: John drove for 3 hours at 60 miles per hour (mph), so he traveled 180 miles.
ost_step.2: However, he turned back around, which means he was now traveling backwards.
ost_step.3: He spent another 6 hours (2 hours waiting in traffic + 0.5 hours driving at 30 mph + 3 hours driving at 80 mph) going backwards, but since distance equals rate times time and he was going at a negative speed (negative because we consider "backwards" as moving opposite the positive direction) we use absolute value: |speed| * time.
ost_step.4: His total distance traveled during his trip was:

direct_answer.text:
John initially drove for 3 hours at a speed of 60 miles per hour (mph). Therefore, he traveled a distance of 180 miles. Since he turned around, this distance would be subtracted from his eventual distance to find out how far he is from home when he arrives.

Next, John encountered 2 hours of standstill traffic. During this time, he didn't travel any distance. Following that, John drove at a speed of 30 miles per hour for half an hour, resulting in a distance traveled of 15 miles. Finally, John drove at a speed of 80 miles per hour for three hours, resulting in a distance traveled of 240 miles. Note that we must calculate the distance traveled during this last segment with an absolute value, since we're traveling in the opposite direction. Thus, the total distance John traveled during his entire trip was:

180 miles - distance traveled after turning around = 180 miles - |-360 miles| = 420 miles

Since John travels 420 miles during his entire trip and he started from his home, the distance from home to his destination would be 4

subanswer.text: During the first 3 hours, John drove at a speed of 60 miles per hour (mph). One mile is equal to 1609.34 meters (m), and one hour is equal to 3600 seconds (s). Therefore, 60 mph is equivalent to 60 * 1609.34 / 3600 = 97.22 meters per second (m/s). In 3 hours, John would have driven a distance of 3 * 97.22 = 291.67 kilometers or approximately 181.34 miles. The answer is approximately 181.34 miles.
